text:
Municipal farms (dormitories) on Riker's Island.
About 1925.?
title: Islands - Rikers Island - Municipal farms' dormitories.

text:
(1) Filling in and leveling Riker's Island with refuse tower there after collection be New York's Department of Sanitation.
About 1925 ?

(2) The mounds of refuse as seen from the East River.
July 1, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Islands - Rikers Island - Refuse heaps.

text:
(1) Riker's Island is situated in the East River, east of Randall's Island and between the Bronx and Astoria. This view is seen from the end of 132nd Street, in the Bronx.

November 10, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, a closer view showing the Ferry slip.

September 18, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) Similar to No. 2, but more inclusive. Note the new prison buildings completed.

July 1, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Islands - Rikers Island - [Ferry slip.]

text:
(1)
Fire-fighting on Riker's Island, east of the new prison, caused partly by huge refuse heaps. In the background, are partly destroyed railroad tracks.
September 18, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, another view.
September 18, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
title: Islands - Rikers Island - Fire fighting.

text:
(1) The new prison being constructed on Riker's Island, overshadows this portion of the old one.

September 18, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The structural progress of the new Riker's Island Prison, showing the southwestern and.

September 18, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) The same, from another angle. The old prison is hard to see in the background.

September 18, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

text:
The warden's home on Riker's Island.

September 18, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Islands - Rikers Island - Warden's home.

text:
Rikers Island; A view northward of the Island from a point on the East River and showing a smaller plot in the foreground. Buildings shown are at the ferry slip and consist mainly of the newly constructed prison quarters. The mounds appearing on the easterly portions are composed of ashes and debris collected in the City by the Department of Sanitation. This is a set of three views; one and two being similar, while No. 3 shows a limited view. Appearing in the foreground of the latter is the tug, George Waldie with several barges.

July 1, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Islands - Rikers Island - [Tug George Waldie with several barges.]

July 1, 1937.
